abstract:
<jats:p>A Gram-negative, motile, non-spore-forming, rod-shaped strain, TF-27<jats:sup>T</jats:sup> (=KCCM 41648<jats:sup>T</jats:sup>=JCM 11814<jats:sup>T</jats:sup>), was isolated from a tidal flat in Korea. This organism grew well at 25–35 °C, with optimum growth at 30 °C. Strain TF-27<jats:sup>T</jats:sup> grew optimally in the presence of 2 % NaCl; it did not grow without NaCl or in the presence of >8 % NaCl. Strain TF-27<jats:sup>T</jats:sup> simultaneously contained both menaquinones and ubiquinones as isoprenoid quinones. The predominant menaquinone was MK-7 and the predominant ubiquinones were Q-7 and Q-8. The major fatty acids in strain TF-27<jats:sup>T</jats:sup> were iso-C<jats:sub>15 : 0</jats:sub> (20·6 %) and iso-C<jats:sub>15 : 0</jats:sub> 2-OH and/or C<jats:sub>16 : 1</jats:sub>
                  <jats:italic>ω</jats:italic>7<jats:italic>c</jats:italic> (21·1 %). The DNA G+C content of strain TF-27<jats:sup>T</jats:sup> was 42 mol%. Phylogenetic analyses based on 16S rDNA sequences showed that strain TF-27<jats:sup>T</jats:sup> falls within the radiation of the cluster that is encompassed by the genus <jats:italic>Shewanella</jats:italic>. Levels of 16S rDNA sequence similarity between strain TF-27<jats:sup>T</jats:sup> and the type strains of <jats:italic>Shewanella</jats:italic> species were 93·2–96·8 %. On the basis of phenotypic properties and phylogenetic data, strain TF-27<jats:sup>T</jats:sup> should be placed in the genus <jats:italic>Shewanella</jats:italic> as a novel species, for which the name <jats:italic>Shewanella gaetbuli</jats:italic> sp. nov. is proposed.</jats:p>
title: Shewanella gaetbuli sp. nov., a slight halophile isolated from a tidal flat in Korea
